But Exxon’s reputation for fobbing off such concerns means investors need to not just trust  but verify.

Headline: Exxon climate vote puts sector on notice
Article: DALLAS (Reuters Breakingviews) - Exxon Mobil shareholders have finally won a long-sought climate-change victory. Over 60 percent of them backed a move that forces the $340 billion oil giant to ramp up global-warming disclosure  up from under 40 percent in a similar attempt last year. Exxon already embraces the debate more than most. But shareholders want the company to be more forthcoming. Holdout industry peers will have to follow or risk investor ire.

Headline: Exxon sees a world with less carbon but higher-cost emissions

Headline: Series of leaks caused blast at Exxon's Calif. refinery -investigator
Article: HOUSTON  Jan 13 A U.S. safety agency said on Wednesday that a series of problems at Exxon Mobil Corp's  California refinery caused an explosion there nearly a year ago  as questions mounted about when the plant  which supplies 10 percent of the state's gasoline supply  would be fixed.

Headline: Europe refiners rush to make more gasoline after diesel hangover

Headline: Breakingviews: Exxon investors may rue climate-risk indifference
Article: By Kevin Allison and Ben Kellerman Exxon Mobil investors may regret their indifference to climate risks. The oil major's shares barely budged on news that New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman is investigating whether the company misled owners about global warming. The probe adds legal teeth to the carbon-bubble debate. Shareholders  though  seem more worried about oil prices.

Article: LONDON  Aug 22 Indonesia's state oil firm Pertamina is set to buy a stake in Iraq's giant West Qurna oilfield from Exxon Mobil  joining PetroChina in the $50 billion project  industry and Iraqi oil sources said on Thursday.

Headline: Freepoint Commodities invests in U.S. offshore oil and gas production
Article: NEW YORK  Aug 19 Freepoint Commodities LLC said on Monday that  together with two other partners  it bought two offshore oil and gas producing blocks from an Exxon Mobil Corp  affiliate and W&T Offshore Inc for $110 million.

Headline: UPDATE 1-InterOil says talks with Exxon ongoing over PNG gas fields
Article: Aug 16 InterOil Corp and ExxonMobil Corp  remain in talks to jointly develop InterOil's Elk and Antelope natural gas fields in Papua New Guinea  InterOil said on Friday after a website reported negotiations had ended without an agreement.

Headline: RPT-Turkey plays big in Kurdistan's energy game
Article: ANKARA  Aug 15 Turkey has quietly built up a large presence in Kurdistan's oil and gas industry  teaming up with U.S. major Exxon Mobil  as Ankara bets on Iraq's semi-autonomous republic to help wean it off costly Russian and Iranian energy imports.

Headline: Turkey plays big in Kurdistan's energy game
Article: ANKARA Turkey has quietly built up a large presence in Kurdistan's oil and gas industry  teaming up with U.S. major Exxon Mobil  as Ankara bets on Iraq's semi-autonomous republic to help wean it off costly Russian and Iranian energy imports.

Headline: Exxon  Shell advance in Newfield's Asia auction: sources
Article: HONG KONG/KUALA LUMPUR Energy majors Exxon Mobil Corp  and Royal Dutch Shell  are among the suitors advancing to the next round of bidding for Newfield Exploration Co's  Malaysian and Chinese oil and gas fields valued at about $1.2 billion  people familiar with the matter said.

Headline: UPDATE 1-Exxon  Shell advance in Newfield's Asia auction-sources
Article: * Newfield unloading older assets to invest closer to home

Headline: Exxon  Shell advance in Newfield's Asia auction-sources
Article: HONG KONG/KUALA LUMPUR  Aug 15 Energy majors Exxon Mobil Corp and Royal Dutch Shell are among the suitors advancing to the next round of bidding for Newfield Exploration Co's Malaysian and Chinese oil and gas fields valued at about $1.2 billion  people familiar with the matter said.

Headline: UPDATE 1-Oilfield services provider Frank's shares jump in debut
Article: Aug 9 Shares of Frank's International NV  a provider of drilling equipment and services to Chevron Corp  and Exxon Mobil Corp among others  soared 30 percent in the company's debut as investors bet on international growth.

Headline: Exclusive: PetroChina to join Exxon at giant Iraqi oilfield
Article: BEIJING/MOSCOW China's biggest energy firm PetroChina  will join Exxon Mobil  in developing Iraq's giant West Qurna oilfield and is in talks with Russia's Lukoil  to buy into a second project at the field  industry sources said.

Headline: Frank's International shares rise 27 percent in market debut
Article: Shares of Frank's International NV   a provider of drilling equipment and services to Chevron Corp   Exxon Mobil Corp  and ConocoPhillips  among others  jumped as much as 27 percent in the company's market debut.

Headline: Conoco in $720 million oil sands deal with Exxon  Imperial
Article: ConocoPhillips  is selling its stake in a Canadian oil sands project to Exxon Mobil Corp  and Imperial Oil Ltd  for about $720 million as it focuses on its U.S. shale oil and natural gas operations.

Headline: UPDATE 2-Conoco in $720 mln oil sands deal with Exxon  Imperial
Article: Aug 8 ConocoPhillips is selling its stake in a Canadian oil sands project to Exxon Mobil Corp  and Imperial Oil Ltd for about $720 million as it focuses on its U.S. shale oil and natural gas operations.

Headline: UPDATE 3-Decades-old defect caused Exxon's Arkansas oil spill -regulator
Article: WASHINGTON  Aug 1 A leak in Exxon Mobil Corp's  nearly 70-year-old Pegasus pipeline  which spilled thousands of barrels of crude oil in a small Arkansas town in March  appears to have been caused by an original  manufacturing defect  U.S. regulators said on Thursday.

Headline: Exxon pipeline leak caused by manufacturing defect -U.S. report
Article: WASHINGTON  Aug 1 A leak in Exxon Mobil's  Pegasus pipeline  which spilled thousands of barrels of crude oil in a small Arkansas town in March  was caused by a manufacturing defect  and the line will remain shut until it can be restarted safely  U.S. regulators said on Thursday.

Headline: Exxon's quarterly profit falls short of Street view
Article: Exxon Mobil Corp  on Thursday reported a sharp fall in quarterly profit on lower oil and gas output production and weaker earnings from its refining business.

Headline: UPDATE 2-Exxon's quarterly profit falls short of Street view
Article: Aug 1 Exxon Mobil Corp on Thursday reported a sharp fall in quarterly profit on lower oil and gas output production and weaker earnings from its refining business.     "I think the (earnings) shortfall was across the board " Brian Youngberg  oil analyst at Edward Jones in St Louis. "The biggest miss was on the downstream  the refining margins were well below expectations."     The world's largest publicly traded oil company reported profit at $6.9 billion  or $1.55 per share  down 57

Headline: Exxon's quarterly profit lower  output off 1.9 pct
Article: Aug 1 Exxon Mobil Corp on Thursday reported a 57 percent decline in second-quarter profit as oil and gas output dropped  and earnings for its refining business fell.

Headline: Frank's Int. raises IPO size by nearly half to up to $724.5 mln
Article: July 29 Frank's International N.V.  which provides drilling equipment to Chevron Corp  Exxon Mobil Corp and ConocoPhillips  increased the size of its initial public offering by about 45 percent to up to $724.5 million.

Headline: U.S. appeals court upholds $105 million Exxon payout in NYC case
Article: NEW YORK A U.S. appeals court on Friday upheld a ruling against Exxon Mobil Corp ordering the company to pay $105 million in damages for polluting New York City's groundwater with a toxic gasoline additive.

Headline: UPDATE 1-U.S. appeals court upholds $105 mln Exxon payout in NYC case
Article: NEW YORK  July 26 A U.S. appeals court on Friday upheld a ruling against Exxon Mobil Corp ordering the company to pay $105 million in damages for polluting New York City's groundwater with a toxic gasoline additive.

Headline: Louisiana agency sues big oil firms for hurting wetlands
Article: NEW ORLEANS A Louisiana agency sued 97 oil companies - including BP Plc  Exxon Mobil Corp  Chevron Corp and Royal Dutch Shell Plc - in state court on Wednesday for allegedly damaging hundreds of miles of sensitive wetlands by cutting through them with pipelines and transportation canals.

Headline: UPDATE 1-Louisiana agency sues big oil firms for hurting wetlands
Article: NEW ORLEANS  July 24 A Louisiana agency sued 97 oil companies - including BP Plc  Exxon Mobil Corp   Chevron Corp and Royal Dutch Shell Plc  - in state court on Wednesday for allegedly damaging hundreds of miles of sensitive wetlands by cutting through them with pipelines and transportation canals.

Headline: XTO Energy agrees to pay $100 000 fine for fracking spill
Article: NEW YORK An Exxon Mobil Corp  subsidiary agreed to pay a $100 000 fine for spilling wastewater from a natural gas drilling site in Pennsylvania that polluted a local river  U.S. regulators said on Thursday.

Headline: XTO Energy agrees to pay $100 000 fine for fracking spill
Article: NEW YORK  July 18 An Exxon Mobil Corp  subsidiary agreed to pay a $100 000 fine for spilling wastewater from a natural gas drilling site in Pennsylvania that polluted a local river  U.S. regulators said on Thursday.

Headline: ConocoPhillips to pay BP  Exxon for Alaska pipeline costs
Article: ANCHORAGE  Alaska ConocoPhillips  Alaska's top-volume oil producer  will pay about $264 million to BP Plc to help cover the cost of transporting crude through the Trans Alaska Pipeline (TAPS)  under a settlement approved on Tuesday by federal officials.

Headline: ConocoPhillips to pay BP  Exxon for Alaska pipeline costs
Article: ANCHORAGE  Alaska  July 16 ConocoPhillips   Alaska's top-volume oil producer  will pay about $264 million to BP Plc to help cover the cost of transporting crude through the Trans Alaska Pipeline (TAPS)  under a settlement approved on Tuesday by federal officials.

Headline: Exxon books US-flagged American Phoenix tanker at near record $100 000/day
Article: NEW YORK  June 27 ExxonMobil has taken a long-term charter on the U.S.-flagged American Phoenix oil tanker at a near record rate of around $100 000 per day  trade sources said  highlighting the scarcity of vessels available to ship oil and refined products between United States ports.

Headline: Exxon seeking LNG export license in Canada
Article: HOUSTON  June 20 Exxon Mobil Corp is seeking a license to export 30 million tonnes of liquefied natural gas (LNG) per year to Asian markets from the coast of British Columbia  according to a regulatory filing in Canada.

Headline: UPDATE 1-BP looks at tough onshore Russian projects with Rosneft
Article: * British major to offer skills and technology to Rosneft
